medical_history.chief_complaint: Bilateral pulmonary infiltrates, bloody sputum, and microhematuria.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately two months before admission with fever and epistaxis, suspected acute sinusitis, and self-treatment with azithromycin. Symptoms evolved to include bilateral ear pressure, tonsillar exudates, and arthralgias in the ankles, knees, and hands, accompanied by night sweats. Cough with thick, blood-streaked sputum and bloody nasal discharge developed around this time.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic paranasal sinusitis, allergic rhinosinusitis; sinus surgery performed 17 months prior.
medical_history.social_history: Drinks little alcohol, has never smoked, traveled to the Dominican Republic five months before admission, and has traveled extensively in the Caribbean, Central America, and Europe.
